translation: Again, what are the first signs that the great king dreamt of seeing eight things? Suppose he sees white sandalwood mud all over his body and rubs it on it, and there's a king in Vaiśravaṇa who sends a large white cloth to the great king!

source_sentence: 今至半路，經七日後必當來至，此為先兆。

source_sentence: 「又見赤栴檀香水澆灑身者，有健陀羅國王送赤毛寶緂來奉大王！
translation: Also, when he saw red sandalwood perfume poured over his body, the king of Gandhāra sent a red-haired jeweled silkworm to offer it to the great king!

source_sentence: 今至半路，經七日後亦當屆此，此為先兆。
translation: I am now halfway there and will also return here seven days from now. This is a omen for the future arrival of my journey.

source_sentence: 「又見頭上火然者，有槃那國王送上金鬘來奉大王，在路而來，經七日後亦來至此，此為先兆。

source_sentence: 「又見兩腋下垂大毒蛇者，有支那國王送二寶劍來奉大王，隨路而行七日當至，此為先兆。
translation: “Furthermore, when he saw a large poisonous snake hanging from his armpits, the king of Cīna sent two-jeweled swords to offer them to the king and they followed the road for seven days before arriving, which was a omen.

source_sentence: 「又見二鯉魚舐兩足者，有師子洲國王送一雙寶履來奉大王，尋路而來，七日當至，此為先兆。
translation: “Furthermore, I saw two carp fish licking their feet. A lion king of the continent sent a pair of jeweled footstools to present them to the great king. They came on their way and were due to arrive in seven days; this was a omen.

source_sentence: 「又見二白鵝飛空而來者，有吐火羅國王送二駿馬來奉大王，尋路而來，七日當至，此為先兆。
translation: Again, I saw two white geese flying in the air and coming. The king of Tukhāra sent two swine and horses to present them to the great king. They came on their way and were due to arrive seven days before dawn. This was a omen.

source_sentence: 「又見大黑山當面而來者，有羯陵伽國王送大象王二頭來奉大王，尋路而來，七日當至，此為先兆。
translation: “Furthermore, if you see the great black mountain coming toward your face, a king of the country of Kaliṅga sends two large elephant kings to present their heads to the king. They come on their way and will arrive in seven days; this is a omen.

source_sentence: 「又見白鷗鳥頭上遺糞者，牛護之母安樂夫人，此為先兆，王自當知。

translation: After hearing this teaching, King Rāmaṅgaprabha rejoiced and jumped up and down like death and regained consciousness. source_sentence: 別安大竹、遮掌馬人、枯竭池中添水令滿、放象并鹿及被繫鵝，滿七日已如所記事皆悉到來。
translation: They placed large bamboo trees, covered palms with horsemen, filled the dried-up ponds with water to make them full, released elephants, deer, and bound geese, and arrived seven days later as described.

source_sentence: 王見是已，更於尊者極生敬重，作如是念：「但我宅中所有吉祥，皆是聖者福力所致，我今且以初得大緂奉持供養，後以王位奉禪尊者。」
translation: Seeing this, the king became even more respectful to the venerable and thought, But all the auspicious signs in my house are caused by the noble person's power of merit, so now that I've first attained a great deal of respect, I'll make offerings to them as an offering and then serve the honored Chan master at the king's throne.

translation: After the five treasures offered to him by King Fiery Light were all shared, he went to the Venerable's place, bowed his head at his feet, sat to one side, and said, Mañjuśrī!

translation: It's difficult to explain the profound matter of compassionate creation, so I respectfully present my country and position to the venerable, only wishing to receive it with kindness, pity, and sympathy.

source_sentence: 尊者報曰：「世尊有教，遮諸苾芻不受王位。」
translation: The venerable replied, Bhagavān, the Bhagavān has taught that it's forbidden for monks to accept the king's position.

translation: The king said, If that's the case, he'll accept half a kingdom.

source_sentence: 答曰：「此亦不聽。」
translation: He replied, I won't listen here, either.

translation: The king said, If you become the king of a country that's hindered by the Buddha, it's reasonable for you to receive and use the five desires without harming them; I will give them all.

translation: All the buddhas of desire won't allow it.

translation: The king said, If this isn't appropriate, it's fortunate that all the sensations and the above-mentioned sensations will be used for the benefit of those who receive them according to their feelings.

translation: It was then that the Buddha was staying in Jeta's Grove in Śrāvastī, and the great teacher didn't know what he saw, so he thought, Suppose Kātyāyana doesn't need anything for himself to receive or use it, but he should accept it for the sake of future monks.

translation: After this thought, he gives rise to a worldly mind.

translation: The Buddhas always teach the eternal truth: When one gives rise to worldly thoughts, even insects and ants also know the Buddha’s thoughts.

translation: Knowing Kātyāyana's intention for this, the Bhagavān then arouses a worldly mind and causes Kātyāyana to hear and see each other with the divine eye of that god's ear.

translation: Does a monk get to take the things that are used and the above-mentioned things?

translation: The Buddha said, Because I want to pity the monks of future generations and cause the donor's good fortune to increase, therefore I'll now listen to the saṃgha in the four directions who obtain things that are received and used for the sake of the saṃgha and those who receive them above, not others.

source_sentence: 此中受用謂是村田。
translation: Here, sensation and function are called village fields.

source_sentence: 上受用者，謂是牛羊等。」
translation: Those who receive and use the above are cattle, sheep, and so forth.

source_sentence: 于時尊者請世尊已，白猛光王曰：「世尊已許，為四方僧伽得取受用及上受用，為欲哀愍未來世中諸苾芻故，又令施主福報增故。」
translation: After the Bhagavān had invited the Bhagavān, the Venerable then said to King Mahāprajñāpāramitā, The Bhagavān has given his permission for the saṃgha in the four directions to receive and use it as well as the higher recipients because they want to pity the monks of future generations and cause the donor's merit to increase.

source_sentence: 時王即為尊者遂造大寺，四事供養悉皆充足，莊田牛畜施四方僧。
translation: The king then built a large temple for the Venerable, which had four kinds of offerings that were all plentiful and provided land, cattle, and livestock to the saṃgha in the four directions.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「我今最初許鄔波索迦為諸聲聞四方僧眾施受用物，謂是嗢逝尼城猛光王為首。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Now, for the first time, I'll allow Upāsaka to give alms to the śrāvakas and saṃgha in the four directions for their use, saying that it's led by King Rāṣṭrapāla of Vajrapāśaṇi.

translation: He also initially agreed to allow Upāsaka to give cakes and food for the śrāvakas and saṃgha of the four directions, saying that it was led by the great king Upariṭṭṭha, the lord of Magadha on Vulture Peak's mountain.

source_sentence: 又我最初許鄔波索迦為諸聲聞四方僧眾施其臥具，謂是室羅伐城給孤長者為首。
translation: Also, when I first agreed to allow Upāsaka to give bedding for the śrāvakas and monks in the four directions, I said that this was the city of Śrāvastī given to an orphaned elder as the head of the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 又我最初許鄔波索迦為諸聲聞四方僧眾造毘訶羅，謂是婆羅痆斯善賢長者為首。」
translation: Furthermore, when I first agreed to allow Upāsaka to create the Vaiśravaṇa for the śrāvakas and saṃgha in the four directions, I said that this was the elder Śanxian of Vārāṇasī as the head.

source_sentence: 猛光一切施，　　影勝施餅初；
translation: Fierce Light is the first of all kinds of offerings, and Refutation is the first of the best gifts.

source_sentence: 臥具謂給孤，　　善賢造僧寺。
translation: The bedding is given to the orphaned, and Shanxian builds a monk's temple.
